subject: Communication
title: Labeling Emotions to Tame Them
description: A micro-lesson that makes Labeling Emotions to Tame Them usable.

hook.text: FBI negotiators don't argue with hostage-takers. They say: 'It sounds like you're feeling frustrated.' It works.

buildup.text: Affect labeling ‚Äî naming an emotion out loud ‚Äî reduces amygdala activity by up to 50%, according to UCLA studies.

discovery.text: When you label someone's emotion, it signals understanding. The other person feels heard and their defensive walls.

twist.text: The label must be tentative ('It seems like...'), not declarative ('You're angry!').

climax.text: Chris Voss, former FBI negotiator, calls this 'tactical empathy' ‚Äî using emotional intelligence as a de-escalation tool.

punchline.text: Name the emotion. Tame the conflict.
